TopicTitle: What are your plans for the solar eclipse?

Articles.Content: Craters of the Moon national park in Idaho was at 4x it's usual traffic today.

There are still live streams.

https://eclipse2017.nasa.gov/nasa-edge

or http://www.cnn.com/specials/vr/total-solar-eclipse-2017

3 hours ago, cubinator said:

Craters of the Moon national park in Idaho was at 4x it's usual traffic today.

Craters was nutso on Friday too. I won't even comment on the crowds at Devil's Tower. About as busy as it was in "Close Encounters of the Third Kind." (I skipped the DT park and went to North Dakota and back instead. I mean - I've seen the big mound of mashed potatoes, what else is there? I probably made it to ND before the cars in line ahead of me made it into the DT park proper.)

Based on weather, looks like I'm headed south towards Douglas. I'll most likely just find a couple of nice railfanning spots south of Bill, WY, and combine the eclipse with train watching. 

Edited August 21, 2017 by Cydonian Monk
I was offered a campsite at a friend's dig (he's an archeologist) in Wyoming, but the lone drive not worth it.

Currently in Columbia SC after a 19 hour drive yesterday. The weather is looking pretty nice, with not much cloud cover, low rain chance, and temperatures around 90*F. I'm going to view the eclipse at the University of South Carolina, which is doing a total of 15 eclipse-related stations. One of them is viewing of the partial eclipse through the campus's solar filtered observatory. This gives me an incredible opportunity to take close-up images of the partial eclipse. I will also take a ton of videos, including some during totality. In addition, I'll use both my phone and camera to photograph the total eclipse.

I've already had a great time in Columbia, with plenty of images to share when I get back home. You won't BELIEVE how many beautiful five-lined skinks I was able to find and photograph at Congaree National Park!
I'm thinking about heading up to a place where the eclipse is total, and then play Eclipse by Pink Floyd while totality is underway.
When you're on the opposite side of the world...

School.

And, according to mom, I may not even see it due to the school not wanting to risk having to pay for some idiot 3rd graders eyeballs getting damaged. WAI
Spoiler
Kraken krap... It's starting to really cloud up here... stupid Florida weather... not sure if we'll get to see much or not at this point..

Yesterday i thought i could have a chance to get a view of the beginning of the eclipse at sunset here on La Palma island (30-40% obstruction). But the horizontal view is down to 2-3km now because of dust and mist in the lower atmosphere.
Clear skies in Tennessee. Looks good for viewing the total eclipse
First contact has begun in Oregon!

54 minutes ago, ProtoJeb21 said:

First contact has begun in Oregon!

I thought it's already happening ! It's already August 22 down here...

Good luck everybody, watch out the shadows !

Anyway, another tip to capture partials : just take a shot of the sun, no need for filters, preferably from a standard digital camera (phone camera also works, and the ones I've seen come from those). The optical artifact will show the sun's apparent shape. It'll be a crescent during partials. This is how I alerted some people past the event here that they actually took a photograph during the partial eclipse.

Edited August 21, 2017 by YNM
THAT WAS SO FLIPPING FLAPPING COOL!
Wow that was great!
About half of the Sun is currently covered. Less than 40 minutes until totality.
I'm in the area where totality doesn't exist I got to see some of it though and it's amazing!

Has anyone got surrounding pictures/videos ? Not even NASA do them !

 

Edited August 21, 2017 by YNM

I could see Venus for a long time before and after the total eclipse.

Traffic wasn't so bad beforehand because people filtered in slowly, but almost everyone decided to leave right after totality ended and it's probably the biggest traffic jam in Idaho's history. Definitely waiting until tomorrow to drive to Yellowstone. 

Edited August 21, 2017 by cubinator

1 minute ago, cubinator said:

... almost everyone decided to leave right after totality ended and it's probably the biggest traffic jam in Idaho's history. 

They're missing out the partials. Still lots of things to see.

Just now, YNM said:

They're missing out the partials. Still lots of things to see.

I know, right? Technically it's only half over when totality ends! We waited around watching it for a while because it's really cool and nobody's getting bet far in this traffic.

I know, right? Technically it's only half over when totality ends! We waited around watching it for a while because it's really cool and nobody's getting bet far in this traffic.

Are you near a tree shadow ? Do you see tiny crescents in them ?
It was horrible.
